alert.note: Alert for Barton; Butler; Chase; Cowley; Ellsworth; Greenwood; Harper; Harvey; Kingman; Lincoln; Marion; McPherson; Reno; Rice; Russell; Saline; Sedgwick; Sumner (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued December 21 at 3:29PM CST until December 23 at 1:00PM CST by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THURSDAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 1 PM CST FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, freezing drizzle and snow expected. A glaze of ice is expected this afternoon. Total snow accumulations between 1 and 2 inches during the overnight and early morning. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph will cause blowing snow and reduced visibility. * WHERE...Portions of Central, South Central and Southeast Kansas. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, from 10 PM this evening to 1 PM CST Friday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 6 PM CST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the commute this evening and Thursday morning. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Freezing drizzle will be the main concern before midnight. Snow and blowing snow will be the main concern after midnight.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
